wikipedia_page.main: Frederick Charles Erentz (March 1870 – 6 April 1938) was a Scottish footballer who played at half-back and full-back for Dundee Our Boys and Newton Heath in the 1880s, 1890s and early 1900s.

response: Born in Chirk, Denbighshire, Owen began his football career with Chirk before signing for Newton Heath in October 1887.Shury (2002), p. 69. His elder brother, William, also signed from Chirk at the same time. Owen scored six goals in 90 appearances over the span of a six-year career with the Heathens, before losing his place to new signing Fred Erentz, who would go on to serve the club for almost 10 years.
